intro: Tetrameris nitida, commonly known as the silky tetrameris, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or white, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Tetrameris nitida is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
